page.title: 01A General View
page.content: This is mainly a rural area, with the main areas of population situated around the perimeter. The largest village is Werrington which stretches for 3 miles from the Eastern boundary of Stoke-on-Trent to Cellarhead. The main occupation of the area is farming, most of the land is put to this use. Modern housing estates exist at Werrington, Washerwall,and Cellarhead at the South-East corner is a small part of the Bentilee Council Estate. More traditional housing can be found in Hulme Village and scattered through- -out the area. A variety of shops are situated in the larger villages. The major roads running through the area are the Hanley-Cheadle and Stone-Leek roads which cross at Cellarhead.The others are quiet country lanes.
